definitions: in a way that is not securely in position and is likely to fall or collapse

examples.text: the homes hung precariously over the edge of a huge crevice

shortDefinitions: in way that is not securely in position

definitions: in a way that is uncertain or dependent on chance

examples.text: a country poised precariously between economic boom and social catastrophe
the team clung precariously to their lead

shortDefinitions: in way that is uncertain or dependent on chance
